## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm a bit confused about how Verus plans to handle wallets for its users. Can you tell me more about how Verus plans to implement a centralized wallet system?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, Verus does not plan to implement a centralized wallet system. Instead, the Verus wallet is designed to provide users with control over their own assets and transactions, rather than relying on a central authority. This approach ensures that users have full control and autonomy over their digital assets.

**User:**
That's good to know. I've also been wondering about Sapling transactions in Verus. Does Verus support Sapling transactions in its Electrum Server?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, Verus supports Sapling transactions in its Electrum Server. In fact, Verus has enhanced its Electrum Server for Sapling support, making Lite Mode Sapling Z-Transactions possible. The lead developer, Mike Toutonghi, coded the support into the Verus Electrum server, which has been fully tested and seamlessly activated along with the blockchain Sapling activation.

**User:**
I've heard some rumors that Verus hasn't developed any pool software to support Sapling transactions. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that is not true. Verus has coded Sapling-enabled pool software, demonstrating its commitment to the community and the project. This pool software is fully compatible with Sapling transactions, ensuring a seamless experience for users.
How does Verus plan to implement a centralized wallet system for its users?

Verus does not plan to implement a centralized wallet system. Instead, the Verus wallet is designed to provide users with control over their own assets and transactions, rather than relying on a central authority.

cutting edge as a multi-coin wallet.
Additional Fixes and Improvements
This edition of the Verus wallet also fixes a few other issues and improvements, including:
Fixed: Some non-Latin usernames cause failure to load
Fixed: Wallet balance can get out of sync with blockchain when staking
To fix any out-of-sync issues, perform a Rescan by doing the following:
For CLI
Add the parameter -rescan when starting the daemon
For GUI
When starting the GUI click “Activate Coin”, not the dropdown shortcut
Choose “Verus” from the modal and select “Native mode”
Select the “daemon param: rescan” option
Click “Activate Coin”
Further Important Developments by Verus
In addition to this important and ground-breaking update to the Wallet, Verus completed two very important developments in support of the newly improved blockchain upgrade: Electrum and Pool Software.
Sapling Enabled Electrum Server
Verus has enhanced their Electrum Server for Sapling support, making Lite Mode Sapling Z-Transactions possible. Lead developer Mike Toutonghi first noticed that his attempts at finding an Electrum server which would support the new Sapling transactions, were fruitless.
As a result, Mike coded the support into the Verus Electrum server, which has been fully tested and seamlessly activated along with the blockchain Sapling activation at VerusCoin block height 227520.
The Verus Electrum server is able to be used to successfully handle Sapling transactions for “Lite Mode” of Verus and Zcash from the latest Verus v0.4.0f wallet update. This support has been tested and is deployed on Verus’ Electrum Server for use with all lite mode transactions.
Sapling Enabled Pool Software
Being thorough and excellent are two very important qualities to which Verus holds true. Providing fully Sapling compatible pool software is another example of this commitment to the community and the project.
